p: The temperate climate on Madeira Island can also play a key role in modulating Ae. aegypti vector competence for arbovirus transmission. It has been shown that temperature affects the vector competence in a tripartite interaction between mosquito genotype, viral genotype, and environment [ 25, 37]. Considering the Madeira climate, it would be of great importance to assess the vector competence under lower incubation temperature regimes, such as 20 °C, in contrast to the usual incubation temperature of 28 °C.
